Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[linker] Preserve all the jni marshal methods for marked methods" (#1926) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Linker wasn't preserving jni marshal methods for all the marked
methods. As an example, `IUncaughtExceptionHandlerInvoker` type lost
its `__<$>_jni_marshal_methods` nested type during linking as we
didn't find registration attribute on `UncaughtException` method.

That led to falling back to the old registration code with a lot of
reflection usage.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Fix issue #1588" (#1925) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Disconnect callback on cancellation token during ConnectAsync was not making sure the httpConnection.Disconnect() do not happen on the main thread - it can cause Android to throw an exception. For more information read https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/issues/1588 

To fix it we changed the ct.Register in ConnectAsync callback to be just like the one in DoProcessRequest

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "AndroidClientHandler doesn't clear Authorization header on redirect" (#1924) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
We have discovered that the AndroidClientHandler transmits all headers when following redirects with AllowAutoRedirect=true. I could not find any authoritative info how this should be handled, however the HttpClientHandler seems to clear the Authorization header when redirecting (see https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/blob/master/src/System.Net.Http/src/System/Net/Http/SocketsHttpHandler/RedirectHandler.cs).
From my testing, it appears the NSUrlSessionHandler does so too.

Should we change the AndroidClientHandler to be more consistent with the other platforms on this issue?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Redirect to relative url doesn't work with AndroidClientHandler" (#1923) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Execute this code:
```
var client = new HttpClient(new AndroidClientHandler());
var res = await client.GetStringAsync("https://nghttp2.org/httpbin/redirect-to?url=/httpbin/get");
```


<!--
If you have a repro project, you may drag & drop the .zip/etc. onto the issue editor to attach it.
-->

### Expected Behavior
The initial request returns a 302 redirect to relative url: **/httpbin/get**. This endpoint returns a JSON string.

### Actual Behavior
Instead of following the redirect, an exception is thrown:
`System.InvalidCastException: Unable to convert instance of type 'Java.Net.URLConnectionInvoker' to type 'Java.Net.HttpURLConnection'.`
Please note that the code above works fine when using HttpClientHandler instead of AndroidClientHandler

### Version Information

2. Paste below this comment block.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "App gets installed but error on launching in Google Pixel 2, Moto G devices" (#1922) at xamarin/xamarin-android

We have made app with Xamarin. Our app is working in many devices except few such as Google Pixel 2, Moto G Latest Version and we don't have Nexus phones to test.
App store link for the app https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.wealth.centrum

App gets installed but whenever the user tries to launch screen gets attached error. Unable to launch app. Please provide help or suggestion so that this issue is resolved in such kinds of devices.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Migrate to Android NDK r17 and drop "armeabi"" (#1921) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
If we use android-ndk-r17 series, xamarin-android tests do not build anymore:

```
    Android NDK: The armeabi ABI is no longer supported. Use armeabi-v7a.    
```

There is no reason to keep supporting armeabi which **Google does not support**.

Sadly "armeabi" specification in our codebase is quite everywhere. We should take time to eliminate everything.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue ""Running Individual NUnit Tests" does not work, runs ALL tests" (#1920) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
It is very important to minimize test run time for rapid development, so we are supposed to have shortened way to run individual tests. And we assume there is way to do so. https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/blob/master/Documentation/building/unix-instructions.md#running-individual-nunit-tests says that to run individual tests, you should use:

```
$ make run-nunit-tests NUNIT_TESTS=bin/TestDebug/Xamarin.Android.Build.Tests.dll
```

However, it actually doesn't work:

```
/sources/xamarin-android$ make run-nunit-tests NUNIT_TESTS=bin/TestDebug/Mono.Android-Tests.dll
tr: warning: an unescaped backslash at end of string is not portable
tr: warning: an unescaped backslash at end of string is not portable
msbuild /p:Configuration=Debug  /v:normal /binaryLogger:"/sources/xamarin-android//bin/BuildDebug/msbuild-`date +%Y%m%dT%H%M%S`-run-nunit-tests.binlog" build-tools/scripts/RunTests.targets /t:RunNUnitTests
Microsoft (R) Build Engine version 15.4.0.0 ( Wed Nov 29 14:56:11 UTC 2017) for Mono
Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

/devel/lib/mono/msbuild/15.0/bin/MSBuild.dll /binaryLogger:/sources/xamarin-android//bin/BuildDebug/msbuild-20180704T153537-run-nunit-tests.binlog /p:Configuration=Debug /t:RunNUnitTests /v:normal build-tools/scripts/RunTests.targets
Build started 7/4/2018 3:35:37 PM.
Project "/sources/xamarin-android/build-tools/scripts/RunTests.targets" on node 1 (RunNUnitTests target(s)).
RunNUnitTests:
  mono packages/NUnit.ConsoleRunner.3.7.0/tools/nunit3-console.exe  /sources/xamarin-android/build-tools/scripts/../../bin/TestDebug/Xamarin.Android.Build.Tests.dll  --labels=All --result="TestResult-Xamarin.Android.Build.Tests.xml;format=nunit2" --output="bin/TestDebug/TestOutput-Xamarin.Android.Build.Tests.txt"

    CLR Version: 4.0.30319.42000

      /sources/xamarin-android/build-tools/scripts/../../bin/TestDebug/Xamarin.Android.Build.Tests.dll
```

Apparently, it tries to run MSBuild tests, which takes forever to finish.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Unable to select ListView item on any version past 2.5.0.280555" (#3210) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description

I have a Xamarin.Forms app that displays a list view on the main view after launching.  After updating to any version past 2.5.0.280555 (2.5.1 or any 3.x version), I'm no longer able to select any list view items on that view.  If I navigate to other list views in the app, I can select items just fine.  

The list view in question: https://github.com/timrisi/AuroraSquadBuilder/blob/master/SquadBuilder/View/MainView.xaml#L34

Also, when I select an item on that first list view on 2.5.x, while it selects just fine and navigates to the next view as expected, it ALSO brings up the ContextAction menu for the selected item, despite not doing a long tap/hold.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Build and run the app for android using any xamarin.forms version after 2.5.0.
2. Tap the + button in the top right to add a squad.
3. Tap 'Save'
4. Tap the back arrow to navigate back to the first list view
5. Tap on the item in the list view

### Expected Behavior

Item is selected and the app navigates to a new view to show details for the item

### Actual Behavior

Nothing happens

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 2.5.1+
- Last known good version: 2.5.0.280555
- IDE: Visual Studio for Mac
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  - Android: Target 4.4, API level 19
- Android Support Library Version: 25.4.0.2

### Reproduction Link

<!-- Please upload or provide a link to a reproduction case -->
https://github.com/timrisi/AuroraSquadBuilder

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Xamarin Forms WebView ignores port" (#3213) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

Xamarin Forms WebView ignores port whent setting WebView.Source (IOS only) in version 3.0.0.561731 and later.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a new project with a simple WebView (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/xamarin/xamarin-forms/user-interface/webview)
2. Set url with non-standard port: this.Browser.Source = "http://portquiz.net:8080/";

### Expected Behavior

App should open the url with port 8080.

### Actual Behavior

App open the url with port 80.
Website shows "You have reached this page on port 80."
On IOS Only!

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.0.0.561731 and later
- Last known good version: 3.0.0.550146
- IDE: Visual Studio 2017 Community
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  - iOS:  11.4 
- Nuget Packages: Xamarin.Forms 3.0.0.561731
- Affected Devices: all (simulator and device)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "In ListView, ViewCell's ContextActions is disappear when swipe right to left on iOS only " (#3217) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
Original: https://bugzilla.xamarin.com/show_bug.cgi?id=58351
This is the same problem in the above link that is still reproducible in the latest Xamarin Form.

When using ContextAction in ViewCell, that is in the ListView. The Context Actions disappear when swipe from right to left. 

This is easy reproducible especially when the hand is not steady and moving a little bit to the left and right before swiping all the way from right to left.  

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Simulate a non steady hand by moving the ViewCell a few pixels to the left and the to the right.
2. Swipe the ViewCell all the way from right to left.

### Expected Behavior

The Context Action (Menu) is shown in the right side of the ViewCell

### Actual Behavior

The Context Action (Menu) area is blank

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[UWP, Android, iOS] Added better life cycle events" (#3214) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

Added life-cycle events, such as `Loaded`, `Unloaded`, `BeforeAppearing` for the VisualElement and `Appeared`, `Disappeared` for the Page. 
Also changed the behavior of the `Appearing` and `Disappearing` events for the Page.

### Issues Resolved ###

<!-- Please use the format "fixes #xxxx" for each issue this PR addresses -->

- fixes #2210

### API Changes ###

Added:
 - event VisualElement.Loaded;
 - event VisualElement.Unloaded;
 - event VisualElement.BeforeAppearing;
 - event Page.Appeared;
 - event Page.Disappeared;

Changed:
 - event Page.Appearing;
 - event Page.Disappearing;

### Platforms Affected ###

- Core (all platforms)
- iOS
- Android
- UWP

### Behavioral/Visual Changes ###

Order of fire events:

| iOS                            | Android                        | UWP                            | 
|--------------------------------|--------------------------------|--------------------------------| 
| [Page] >> loaded >>  | [Page] BeforeAppearing   | [Page] BeforeAppearing   | 
| [Page] BeforeAppearing   | [Page] ++ AppearING >>         | [Page] ++ AppearING >>         | 
| [Page] ++ AppearING >>         | [Button] BeforeAppearing | [Button] BeforeAppearing | 
| [Button] BeforeAppearing | [Page] >> loaded >>            | [Button] >> loaded >>          | 
| [Button] >> loaded >>          | [Page] ++ AppearED ++          | [Page] >> loaded >>            | 
| [Page] ++ AppearED ++          | [Button] >> loaded >>          | [Page] ++ AppearED ++          | 
|                                |                                |                                | 
| [Page] -- DisappearING >>      | [Page] -- DisappearING >>      | [Button] << unloaded <<        | 
| [Button] << unloaded <<        | [Button] << unloaded <<        | [Page] -- DisappearING >>      | 
| [Page] -- DisappearED --       | [Page] << unloaded <<          | [Page] -- DisappearED --       | 
| [Page] << unloaded <<          | [Page] -- DisappearED --       | [Page] << unloaded <<          | 

<!-- Describe any changes that may change how a user's app behaves or appears when upgrading to this version of the codebase. -->

### PR Checklist ###

- [ ] Has automated tests <!-- (if tests are omitted or manual, state reason in description) -->
- [ ] Rebased on top of the target branch at time of PR
- [ ] Changes adhere to coding standard
